stories.title: Show HN: Wanna play fun quizzes solo or with others?

stories.text:
Hi

I would like to know how you usually implement tiers in your SaaS applications and how do you handle the provisioning of features and permissions for users in your services?

Also, how you handle tier/subscription upgrading or downgrading for your users as far as feature management?

Thanks in advance
stories.title: Ask HN: SaaS tier management (features/permissions)
U.S. Wants ASML to Stop Selling Chipmaking Tools to China

stories.text:
It seems like technology people are enthralled with the idea of anti-fragility, which is especially ironic given how much fragility is created from their efforts to build systems that gain from disorder.

Is this just observer bias or is there more of a focus on the idea in tech?
stories.title: Why are tech people obsessed with anti-fragility?

stories.text:
I can do this: https://app.powerbi.com/view?r=eyJrIjoiM2ViNzc5MmQtMDE0ZC00YzAwLWE2YjItYzQ4YWQ1NTdjMmNlIiwidCI6Ijg4OWYxNTI3LWQ4MzYtNGFhNy1iMzE4LTIzYWYwMTUxMGQxYiIsImMiOjl9&pageName=ReportSectionfa5add9a419dcf6577d5

I can program in Python and use PowerBi and GIS. Its more than four years though since I left engineering and joined civil service.

I also have experience running civilian administration and have succesfully incorporated my technical skills to better public service delivery. Being in the bureaucracy, I have experience dealing with scenarios involving different private and public entities to solve complex issues.

What kind of roles can be there for me in the private sector?
stories.title: Civil servant, administrative experience, PowerBi, GIS and Python. Target roles?
